snippet: Democrats moved swiftly to frame the vote as an example of the gulf that exists between the two parties, saying the question is not just one of money, but of morality.
abstract: Senate Democrats condemn Republican-led filibuster of proposal to raise federal minimum wage to $10.10, framing vote as indicator of moral gulf between parties and differing views of economic fairness; Republicans hold that raising minimum wage would damage economy.

byline.contributor: David S. Joachim contributed reporting from Washington, and Megan Thee-Brenan from New York.

lead_paragraph: Democrats moved swiftly to frame the vote as an example of the gulf that exists between the two parties, saying the question is not just one of money, but of morality.

headline.main: Democrats Assail G.O.P. After Filibuster of Proposal to Raise Minimum Wage
headline.print_headline: Democrats Assail G.O.P. After Filibuster of Proposal to Raise Minimum Wage
